title: The Next Emerging-Market Crisis?
sub_head: Developing economies face a perilous return to monetary normal.
body:
The Federal Reserveâ€™s new campaign against inflation is catching many investors in its crosshairs, as Wall Street showed again Wednesday. But spare a thought as well for emerging economies, which often suffer crises as a result of policy mistakes elsewhere and are at risk of another.
The underlying problem is the vast financial flows the Fed and other central banks unleashed with ultraloose monetary policies during the pandemic. The central banks wanted investors to chase returns by taking on greater risks, and some of the best-rewarded risks were in developing economies. Capital flooded into South and Southeast Asia, South America and Africa.
